intro: Stichorkis biglobulifera, commonly known as the two-globule stichorkis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring two prominent globular structures at the base of the flower. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
